topic_metadata.title: How to control spacing between an outer enum and inner bullet list

posts.name: KS84
posts.cooked:
I have a list like this:

+ Item 1

  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2

+ Item 2

  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2

How can I control the spacing between the outer Item(s) and inner Subitem 1? The spacing and leading parameters donâ€™t work for them.
posts.raw:
I have a list like this:
```markdown
+ Item 1

  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2

+ Item 2

  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2
```

How can I control the spacing between the outer Item(s) and inner Subitem 1? The `spacing` and `leading` parameters don't work for them.

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
Hi @KS84, I have moved your question to the Questions category, please make sure to check the category when creating a topic that also means that you can select an answer.

I also added some tags, as it makes your question easier to find.
posts.raw:
Hi @KS84, I have moved your question to the #questions::category category, please make sure to check the category when creating a topic :slight_smile: that also means that you can select an answer.

I also added some tags, as it makes your question easier to find.

posts.cooked:
You mean this?

#show enum: it => {
  show list: x => v(1em) + x
  it
}

+ Item 1
  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2
+ Item 2
  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2
posts.raw:
You mean this?

```typ
#show enum: it => {
  show list: x => v(1em) + x
  it
}

+ Item 1
  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2
+ Item 2
  - Subitem 1
  - Subitem 2
```

![image|145x220](upload://bUZkTnVvo0WhrUdYc5GTsactCsd.png)

posts.name: KS84
posts.cooked:
Yes! This is exactly what I was looking for. Thank you!

@SillyFreak thank you!
posts.raw:
Yes! This is exactly what I was looking for. Thank you!

@SillyFreak thank you!
